decks.notes: The main concept of this combo - Food Chain Legacy deck is to generate infinite mana with Food Chain and exile Misthollow Griffin or Eternal Scourge repeatedly to play Walking Ballista for a lethal finish. It focuses on controlling the board with disruption spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay while also drawing cards and setting up the combo with Brainstorm and Manipulate Fate. The deck includes a variety of creatures like Birds of Paradise and Baleful Strix for ramp and card advantage, as well as a versatile win condition in Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

This deck revolves around utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard quickly and efficiently in order to bring back creatures and tokens from the graveyard. By cycling cards like Street Wraith and Faithless Looting, the deck aims to trigger abilities like Bridge from Below and generate a swarm of zombies. Cabal Therapy and Careful Study are used to further manipulate the graveyard and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures and tokens, ultimately leading to victory through sheer numbers and board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana through Cloudpost and other mana-producing lands, using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith to accelerate further. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having powerful threats like Emrakul and Ulamog to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Trinisphere and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon helps to control the game and ensure the deck's combo can go off smoothly.

The main focus of this Legacy Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and board state with powerful prison effects such as Ensnaring Bridge, Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Magus of the Moon. It aims to lock out the opponent while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck utilizes fast mana acceleration like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly deploy disruptive threats and maintain control of the game using cards like Fiery Confluence and Trinisphere.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token quickly. It uses cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Into the North to find the necessary pieces, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Pithing Needle, Thoughtseize, and Duress. The deck can also protect its combo pieces with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and can generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a massive flying token.

The Grixis Aggro deck aims to quickly disrupt and pressure opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. Utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to apply early pressure while also disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember to deal with threats. With a focus on tempo and aggression, the deck seeks to finish off opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. It also utilizes high-value creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure on the opponent while drawing cards and gaining advantage. The deck's mana base is designed to support a variety of powerful spells, including planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, to control the board and outvalue the opponent.

The deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, using cards like Entomb, Faithless Looting, and Unmask. It then seeks to cheat these creatures into play using spells like Reanimate and Exhume. Cabal Therapy is used to disrupt the opponent's hand and remove potential threats. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with these high-impact creatures before they can recover, utilizing efficient mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to execute the combo efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck using cantrips and draw spells. It aims to set up a critical mass of spells to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or generate enough storm count to win the game with a storm spell. The deck utilizes powerful black rituals and tutors to assemble the necessary pieces to execute its game plan efficiently and effectively, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a burst of spells in a single turn.

The main concept of this Control - Loam deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources using cards like Chalice of the Void, Abrupt Decay, and Wasteland, while generating card advantage and recurring key cards from the graveyard with Life from the Loam. The deck aims to control the game by grinding out incremental advantages with cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Punishing Fire, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for further disruption. The deck excels at resource denial and attrition, ultimately overpowering the opponent with a resilient and versatile game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Wild Growth and Utopia Sprawl while drawing cards with Enchantress effects like Argothian Enchantress and Enchantress's Presence. The goal is to find combo pieces like Solitary Confinement and Replenish to create a lock on the game, while using Living Wish to tutor for specific cards from the sideboard as needed. The deck has a strong synergy between enchantments and card draw, allowing it to outvalue opponents and establish a dominant board presence.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The mana base is optimized for fetching Mountains with fetch lands, while key spells like Price of Progress punish opponents with nonbasic lands. Sulfuric Vortex provides continuous damage, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Eidolon of the Great Revel pressure the opponent. The deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize, utilizing both direct damage spells and creature attacks to win.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to establish early control through cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while using Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck aims to protect its threats like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor with counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The mana base includes efficient dual lands to ensure smooth casting of spells. The overall strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining board control to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive Goblin creatures and disruptive land cards. By utilizing powerful Goblin synergy and mana acceleration from cards like Aether Vial and Skirk Prospector, the deck aims to control the board and deal direct damage efficiently. With cards like Goblin Ringleader and Goblin Matron to fetch more Goblins, the deck can maintain its aggression throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Gempalm Incinerator provide extra removal options to clear the way for Goblins to attack for victory.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and counter magic. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Baleful Strix and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also has strong card advantage engines with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, allowing the player to outvalue their opponent over the course of a game.

The deck focuses on using Blazing Shoal to exile Progenitus from your hand and deal massive infect damage using Blighted Agent and Inkmoth Nexus. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and cantrips to protect the combo and find the necessary pieces quickly. Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility in accessing sideboard cards, while Pact of Negation offers a way to protect the combo without having to pay mana. Spell Pierce and Searing Wind provide additional disruption and finishers, respectively. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through its combo strategy.
